column4: hi guys, not really an Ubuntu question, but I recently added a (third) disk to my system which is a PATA disk. It installed itself before the two SATA disks that had both Ubuntu and XP on it. Not a big deal as I wanted to do a new (64 bit) install of Ubuntu anyways. However, my XP does not start anymore now. GRUB sees it alright and starts loading it, but because XP thinks it's installed on the first disk it thinks it can boot up from there.
pastebin your menu.lst
http://pastebin.ca/658223
i'm not all that comfy with GRUB, but I'd imagine you'd tweak the root
- yeah that sounds logical, you know what's the meaning of the the 'map' lines under the sdb1 section?
sudo in general
well, yeah, was talking about the whole session caching thing :P
im aware
invisible like can't see your text? no
what about USB?
but it works on another machine.
im looking
I'm thinking this link might help you: http://www.linux-usb.org/FAQ.html#ts6
I'm looking in /proc/interrupts and I see  11:     193148    XT-PIC-XT        ohci1394, bcm43xx, nvidia
ohci1394 is Firewire
pastebin your dmesg and I'll look
http://pastebin.ca/817166
thanks, looking
this may be of help too, lspci lists: 00:11.2 USB Controller: VIA Technologies, Inc. VT82xxxxx UHCI USB 1.1 Controller (rev 1b)
it's not that, because USB 2.0 devices should be backwards compatible with 1.1
personally I think it might be something hardware-wise, but don't take me as the final word
